purpose: Defines the canonical JSON Schema dialect and style requirements for all CORE schemas

rules.notes: This rule forbids dialect-specific keywords such as OpenAPI nullable. Standard nullability must be expressed via type unions.
rules.rationale: CORE requires a single unambiguous schema dialect to ensure deterministic validation and tooling interoperability across Mind, Body, and Will.
rules.statement: All schema files under .intent/**/schemas/ must use standard JSON Schema (no OpenAPI extensions).

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: All schema files under .intent/**/schemas/ must use standard JSON Schema (no OpenAPI extensions).

rules.rationale: The nullable keyword is not part of standard JSON Schema and causes inconsistent behavior across validators, which is unacceptable for constitutional SSOT enforcement.
rules.statement: The 'nullable' keyword is forbidden in all schema files; use type unions like ["string","null"].

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: The 'nullable' keyword is forbidden in all schema files; use type unions like ["string","null"].

rules.notes: Recursive closure for nested objects may be elevated later; root closure is mandatory now.
rules.rationale: Closed-world schemas prevent constitutional drift and eliminate acceptance of unknown fields introduced by typos, agents, or uncontrolled evolution.
rules.statement: All schema objects must set additionalProperties=false at the root schema object.

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: All schema objects must set additionalProperties=false at the root schema object.

rules.rationale: Using standard formats improves interoperability and reduces validation ambiguity.
rules.statement: Schemas should use JSON Schema standard format 'date-time' (not 'datetime').

params.instruction: Verify adherence to: Schemas should use JSON Schema standard format 'date-time' (not 'datetime').

title: Schema Dialect Standards
